category_system.description: French profanity categorization considering verlan, regional variations, and cultural context
category_system.methodology: Based on French sociolinguistic research and regional usage patterns

general.name: Profanité Générale
general.description: Common swear words and mild expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration

subcategories.exclamatory: Words used for emphasis (putain, merde, bordel)

sexual.name: Contenu Sexuel
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content

subcategories.anatomy: Sexual body parts and references (bite, con, couilles)
subcategories.prostitution: Terms related to sex work (pute, salope)

religious.name: Profanité Religieuse
religious.description: Blasphemous or sacrilegious language, especially Quebec sacres

slurs.name: Insultes et Termes Dépréciatifs
slurs.description: Derogatory terms targeting specific groups or individuals
slurs.examples_note: Offensive terms for groups and individuals

hate_speech.name: Discours de Haine
hate_speech.description: Language targeting individuals or groups based on identity characteristics

subcategories.racial: Racial slurs and racist language (nègre, etc.)

body_parts.name: Parties du Corps Inappropriées
body_parts.description: Crude or inappropriate references to body parts
body_parts.examples_note: Anatomical terms used inappropriately or crudely

scatological.name: Scatologique
scatological.description: References to bodily waste and bathroom functions

violence.name: Violence et Agression
violence.description: Words promoting or describing violence, threats, or aggressive behavior

subcategories.threats: Direct or implied threats of harm (je vais te tuer)
subcategories.weapons: References to weapons in threatening context
subcategories.physical_harm: Descriptions of violence or harm (casser la gueule)

verlan_profanity.name: Verlan et Argot
verlan_profanity.description: Reversed slang and coded profanity terms

subcategories.reversed_profanity: Direct verlan of profane words (tepu for pute)

1.description: Generally acceptable in casual conversation but may be filtered in formal settings
1.cultural_notes: Often used in friendly context, varies by region

2.description: Inappropriate in most professional or public settings
2.cultural_notes: Context-dependent severity, 'putain' mild in casual French

3.description: Highly offensive and inappropriate in most contexts
3.cultural_notes: Clearly offensive across all French-speaking regions

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially illegal, or causing significant harm
4.cultural_notes: Hate speech level, can have legal consequences in France

france.tolerance_level: Moderate to high for sexual profanity, varies by context

quebec.tolerance_level: Unique religious profanity system, different cultural standards

belgium.tolerance_level: Similar to France but slightly more conservative

switzerland.tolerance_level: More conservative, multilingual context affects usage

special_considerations.verlan_complexity: Verlan forms can mask profanity and complicate detection
special_considerations.quebec_uniqueness: Quebec sacres system completely different from European French
special_considerations.generational_differences: Youth use more verlan and coded language
special_considerations.legal_framework: French hate speech laws affect severity classifications
